Ended up watching 30 Days of Night instead tonight. 7/10 for me. Decently entertaining, but I hated the editing on this movie. So many abrupt cuts, and the "camera shake" in action shots made it too hard to tell what was going on most of the time.

To the movie's credit, it definitely had the most vicious. cold-blooded, and fast-moving vampires I think I've ever seen.

#31

I always recommend Peter Bogdanovich’s first film TARGETS this time a year starring Borris Karloff. It is not a traditional horror film by any means. Karloff essentially plays a fictional version of himself, a washed up horror actor who feels his brand of horror is not scary anymore. Meanwhile, a young man kills his wife and family and begins a mass shooting spree across California. Real horror juxtaposed with film horror. It’s terrific.

To the movie's credit, it definitely had the most vicious. cold-blooded, and fast-moving vampires I think I've ever seen.

I just rewatched it for the second time ever this morning. I enjoyed it, but I definitely don't think it's as great as some people make it out to be. I have the same issues as you and same praises as well.

#33

31 Nights of Halloween 2021:

1.Wrong Turn - The Foundation

So, night one is over and it ended with a huge Dissapointment.

Finally watched the new Wrong Turn reboot after being quite excited for it for a while as fan of the series.

Well Okay, i like the first 2 and the third has its moments...the rest sucks.

Anyway, i do find myself watching WT 1 often and i like it, so thats enough justification to be excited. XD

And boy, they tricked me.

I expected a Hillbilly slasher with due to incest deformed Hillbilly murderers...and i got a cult of Boring people living in the woods just because, killing people.

I couldnt be bothered to care about the movie after that reveal because i felt cheated.

Why would you reboot a Hillbilly slasher series when thats not what you go for?

God damn it, i was super excited for this and got something boring out of it...i curse everyone involved and hope they have stones in their shoes for at least a month.

Hopefully the second night will entertain me more.

#35

Night 1

1. Darkman

Fun Size Review: Raimi's classic about fear, anger and misery, misery, misery. The influence from Burton's Batman is apparent, as is the commonality with Raimi's own Spider-Man. Fun fact. I grew up thinking the lead was Bill Nye, the Science Guy.

2. Tragedy Girls

Fun Size Review: The leads carrying this fun, energetic little tale of aspiring serial killers. The 80's slasher storyline meshes perfectly with the 21st century aesthetic. Also, a surprising amount of known actors fill out the cast, and do so well.

3. Freaky

Fun Size Review: Kathryn Newton is as captivating , as Vince Vaughn is annoyingly dated in this fun romp. I really like this, but I do wonder how much better it would be, with an actor whose go to move for portraying women and gay men wasn't the limp wrist.

4. The Fanatic

Fun Size Review: An absolutely terrible and offensive movie, until it becomes utterly hilarious. Honestly, one of the most interesting character studies of the last few years. Not of any of the characters, but the director himself.

5. Beetlejuice

Fun Size Review: An all time fav, that continues to befuddle me with how much it crams into so little . Seriously, how is this only 90 minutes with everything that happens? It has it all. Incredible performances, music, cinematography, editing, art direction, costume design. Everything. When daylight comes, I don't wanna go home.

#38

31 Nights of Halloween 2021:

1.Wrong Turn - The Foundation

2.Awaken The Shadowman

So night 2 went less bad but still bad.

Awaken the Shadowman is at best a Drama that tries to add the Supernatural to a very boring, tedious, slow movie.

Its pretty much a bad CGI Shadow that shows up and is supposed to pull my strings.

But nothing about the movie is done in a way that works.

Its really not something special, the cover of the movie and the idea of The Shadow being, are the strongest part.

There is this one scene where a Woman comes into a room and suddenly the music slams into the scene, indicating there is a scare there...but i had to watch the scene 3 times before i realized the shadow in the corner was supposed to scare me.

But i didnt notice it because the scene was badly lit, the camera or anything drew my eye towards the shadow.

And honestly, im still not 100% sure if that was even supposed to be the scare.

That is the only scene that i remembered 10 minutes after the movie ended.

#48

Night 2

6. Sinister (New)

Fun Size Review: Sinister has a decent concept and mood, but is let down by an overbearing score and poor direction. A less blah director would have let this film breathe and build tension naturally, without spoiling every movement with the soundtrack. Also considering the story, it would have been nice to get to know the family. The best thing about this ones are the jump scares, that genuinely work pretty well.

7. Venom: Let There Be Carnage (New)

Fun Size Review: This sequel is lean, mean and a lot of fun. It's refreshing that they realized what everyone liked about the first, and just made a sequel to fit that need. This won't win any awards, but I'd easily take it over DC's two offerings this year.

Oct 4, 2021

#49

Probably won't be able to watch a movie every day this month, or make it all the way to 10/31 either since I'm moving at the end of the month, but will get as far as I can anyway. So that said:

1. 30 Days of Night (7/10)

2. Ghoulies (1/10), and Ghoulies II (3/10)

Neither of these were good, but the sequel was certainly more entertaining at least. The one thing I'll give these credit for is their practical effects though! Every time I watch a movie from the 80s (or before), I wonder how they did their practical effects.

3. Malignant (7/10)

Went to go see this at the theater. Dang what a trippy movie. I went in expecting something along the lines of Wan's previous supernatural movies (Conjuring, Insidious, etc) so I was sorta disappointed this wasn't exactly that. Still entertaining though, and did not see that twist coming at all, which totally freaked me out. IMO the ending was a bit campy though. Was hoping for more of a traditional Wan-style stinger.
